identificationModule.briefTitle: Symbicort Maintenance and Reliever Therapy - Experience in Real Life Setting in Malaysia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Symbicort Maintenance And Reliever Therapy - Experience in Real Life Setting in Malaysia - SMARTER Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of the study is to evaluate the satisfaction level of patients using the Symbicort SMART approach for their asthma management.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Satisfaction With Asthma Treatment Questionnaire (SATQ) Scores From Baseline to the Mean of 3 Months and 6 Months After Patient Was Initially Treated With SMART
primaryOutcomes.description: Difference/change in SATQ score between baseline and mean of 3 months and 6 months after SMART treatment as analysed by paired t-test. SATQ is a patient reported questionnaire which consists of 26 questions and scored to a scale of 1-7, the higher score indicating a greater level of satisfaction
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months after each patient was initially treated with Symbicort SMART

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Asthma Control Questionnaire (ACQ-5) Score From Baseline to the Mean of 3 Months and 6 Months After Patient Was Initially Treated With SMART
secondaryOutcomes.description: Difference/change in ACQ-5 scores between baseline and mean of 3 months and 6 months after SMART treatment. ACQ-5 is a 5 question patient reported outcome measuring level of asthma control during the past 7 days and it is scored on scale of 0-6. 0 indicates no symptoms and 6 represents severe symptoms
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months after each patient was initially treated with Symbicort SMART

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosis of asthma for past 6 months and treated with inhaled glucocorticosteroids for at least 3 months.
* Patients who asthma is classified as uncontrolled or partially controlled as defined by GINA 2006 guidelines.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patients already on Symbicort SMART treatment.
* Patients who has respiratory tract infection 30 days before study enrolment.

participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: 201 patients were recruited from 10 government hospital based outpatient clinics from Dec 2007 until May 2008

groups.title: Symbicort 160/4.5 Turbuhaler
groups.description: Treatment with Symbicort 160/4.5 Turbuhaler 1 or 2 inhalations twice daily and when required as reliever
